definitions.definition: To take (a system, etc.) offline; to demote from an active or online state.

Of a system, currently not connected (generally electrically) to a larger network. For example, a power plant which is not connected to the grid, or a computer which is not connected to the Internet or to any other communications service.
definitions.example: I saved the web pages so I could read them later offline.

definitions.definition: (by extension) Happening in the physical world (the real world) as opposed to on the internet.
definitions.example: offline dating

definitions.definition: While offline; with an offline system.
Outside the current meeting, in a more private setting.
Opposition to racism
The value one assigns to oneself or one's abilities in self assessment.
definitions.example: Recognizing one's self-worth is a necessary step to respecting the worth of others.

definitions.definition: A (mechanical) device to perform a certain task
A means, such as an elaborate plan or strategy, to accomplish a certain objective
Something overly artful or artificial
An animal character with human-like characteristics; most commonly refers to such characters created by members of the furry subculture.
definitions.example: What percentage of furries are wolves?

definitions.definition: A member of the furry fandom.
definitions.example: The furry had designed an elaborate costume.

definitions.definition: Someone who roleplays or identifies with a furry character. (Compare therianthrope.)
Covered with fur, or with something resembling fur.
definitions.example: His treatment of our furry friends was nothing short of appalling.

definitions.definition: Of or related to the furry subculture.
A horn used by hunters.
A simple brass instrument consisting of a horn with no valves, playing only pitches in its harmonic series
A plant in the family Lamiaceae grown as a ground cover, Ajuga reptans, and other plants in the genus Ajuga.
Anything shaped like a bugle, round or conical and having a bell on one end.
To announce, sing, or cry in the manner of a musical bugle
A tubular glass or plastic bead sewn onto clothes as a decorative trim
Jet-black
A sort of wild ox; a buffalo.

Any musical instrument (percussion idiophone) made of wooden slats graduated so as to make the sounds of the scale when struck with a small drumstick-like mallet; the standard Western concert xylophone or one of its derivatives.
definitions.example: All I know how to play on my xylophone is "Mary Had a Little Lamb". Would you like to hear it?

definitions.definition: To play a xylophone or to play something else as though it was a xylophone.
To move above a ridged surface so as to hit every ridge, in a manner similar to playing quickly and sequentially on a xylophone.
A large tank of water, in an elevated position, acting as a local reservoir; water is pumped into the tank and fed by gravity to the consumers.
A large metal pipe made to be extended vertically by sections, and used for discharging water upon burning buildings.
(authorship) A dramatic device in which an earlier event is inserted into the normal chronological flow of a narrative.
A vivid mental image of a past trauma, especially one that recurs.
A similar recurrence of the effects of a hallucinogenic drug.
The condition of the flame propagating down the hose of an oxy-fuel welding system.
A query that operates against data from an earlier time, before it was changed.
To undergo a flashback; to experience a vivid mental image from the past.
A variety of red wine from this region.
A variety of wine resembling that of Burgundy; especially from Australia or California.
A dark red colour tinged with purple, like that of Burgundy (red) wine.
Of a deep purple red color like that of Burgundy wine.
An animal that is regarded as a good friend, usually a dog or a horse.
Sounding sorrowful, mournful or melancholic.
definitions.example: a typically plaintive song from Radiohead

definitions.definition: A mammal of which the female has a pouch in which it rears its young, which are born immature, through early infancy, such as the kangaroo or koala, or else pouchless members of the Marsupialia like the shrew opossum.
Of or pertaining to a marsupial.
Of or relating to a marsupium.
definitions.example: the marsupial bones

definitions.definition: The act of shuffling cards.
definitions.example: He made a real mess of the last shuffle.

definitions.definition: The act of reordering anything, such as music tracks in a media player.
An instance of walking without lifting one's feet.
definitions.example: The sad young girl left with a tired shuffle.

definitions.definition: (by extension) A rhythm commonly used in blues music. Consists of a series of triplet notes with the middle note missing, so that it sounds like a long note followed by a short note. Sounds like a walker dragging one foot.
A trick; an artifice; an evasion.
To put in a random order.
definitions.example: Don't forget to shuffle the cards.

definitions.definition: To change; modify the order of something.
To move in a slovenly, dragging manner; to drag or scrape the feet in walking or dancing.
definitions.example: He shuffled out of the room.

definitions.definition: To change one's position; to shift ground; to evade questions; to resort to equivocation; to prevaricate.
To use arts or expedients; to make shift.
To shove one way and the other; to push from one to another.
definitions.example: to shuffle money from hand to hand

definitions.definition: To remove or introduce by artificial confusion.
An addition, an extension.
An appendix to a book or document.
An addition or extension to a building.
An addition to the territory of a country or state, from a neighbouring country or state, normally by military force.
Alternative spelling of annex
To be in the annual rut or mating season.
To have sexual intercourse.
To have sexual intercourse with.
To make a furrow.
(of a road etc) Marked or grooved with ruts.
The act by which somebody is bewitched; a curse or enchantment.
Enchanting.
Not malignant, without malice.
Of a growth in the body, not cancerous.
To disallow; to proscribe.
definitions.example: Smoking in the restaurant is forbidden.

definitions.definition: (ditransitive) To deny, exclude from, or warn off, by express command.
To oppose, hinder, or prevent, as if by an effectual command.
definitions.example: An impassable river forbids the approach of the army.

definitions.definition: To accurse; to blast.
To defy; to challenge.
definitions.example: What part of "no" do you forbid to understand?

definitions.definition: Not allowed; specifically disallowed.
A commissioned military officer of the highest rank in the United States Air Force, NATO grade OF-10,. This rank is currently out of use.
A cultivated shrub of the genus Rubus fruticosus x idaeus, a cross between the blackberry (R. fruiticosus) and raspberry (R. idaeus).
Its fruit, a large sweet berry.
A large, skin-covered drum played with the hands, used in West African and some fusion music.
An abnormal growth protruding from a mucous membrane
A cylindrical coelenterate, such as the hydra, having a mouth surrounded with tentacles
A component of any manufactured goods, kept in reserve to replace one that fails; a spare.
The hindquarters of a four-legged mammal, not including its legs
A cut of meat from the rump of an animal.
The buttocks.
Remnant, as in Rump Parliament.
To turn one's back on, to show one's (clothed) backside to, as a sign of disrespect.
(somewhat vulgar) To fuck. (Compare bum.)
To cheat.
To ramble; to move (or talk) aimlessly.
To move (someone or something) around.
A colourless, odourless, flammable, highly toxic gas
An animal that is between one and two years old; one that is in its second year (but not yet two full years old).
definitions.example: a yearling lamb

definitions.definition: A racehorse that is considered to be one year old until a subsequent January 1st.
A sophomore at West Point military academy.
A form of music originating in Jamaica and associated with Rastafarianism, featuring a heavy bass line and percussive rhythm guitar on the offbeat, often with close vocal harmonies.

The military forces of a nation, such as the army, navy, air force, marines, and sometimes, coastguard or border guard, which are tasked with the defence of the nation and its citizens, if necessary through use of deadly force.
The action of detaching; separation.
The state of being detached or disconnected; insulation.
Indifference to the concerns of others; disregard; nonchalance; aloofness.
Absence of bias; impartiality; objectivity.
The separation of a military unit from the main body for a particular purpose or special mission.
The unit so dispatched.
A permanent unit organized for special duties.
Any smaller portion of a main body separately employed.
To make diverse or various in form or quality; to give variety to distinguish by numerous differences or aspects.
The combination of mainstream medicine, based on scientific evidence, and alternative medicine.
One who loves and cares for another person in a romantic way; a sweetheart, love, soulmate, boyfriend, girlfriend or spouse.
A sexual partner, especially one with whom someone is having an affair.
A person who loves something.
definitions.example: a lover of fine wines

definitions.definition: (with "my") An informal term of address for any friend.
definitions.example: All right, me lover?

definitions.definition: A type of turret on the roof of certain medieval buildings designed to allow ventilation or the admission of light.
(chiefly in plural) A series of sloping overlapping slats or boards which admit air and light but exclude rain etc.
Any of a system of slits, as in the hood of an automobile, for ventilation.
In a controversial manner.
Belonging to the first ages
Primary; original
Primitive
The shedding or spilling of blood.
A slaughter; destruction of life, notably on a large scale.
The shedding of one's own blood; specifically, the death of Christ.
A bloodshot condition or appearance; an effusion of blood in the eye.
The facility on an airfield or airport where aircraft are loaded and unloaded of passengers or freight
A person who performs a solo.
Of or relating to birth.
Of or relating to the buttocks.
A powdered substance produced by firing (calcining) calcium carbonate (limestone) and clay that develops strong cohesive properties when mixed with water. The main ingredient of concrete.
The paste-like substance resulting from mixing such a powder with water, or the rock-like substance that forms when it dries.
Any material with strong adhesive and cohesive properties such as binding agents, glues, grout.
A bond of union; that which unites firmly, as persons in friendship or in society.
definitions.example: the cement of our love

definitions.definition: The layer of bone investing the root and neck of a tooth; cementum.
To affix with cement.
To overlay or coat with cement.
definitions.example: to cement a cellar floor

definitions.definition: To unite firmly or closely.
To make permanent.
A type of deformed growth occurring on the skin caused by the human papillomavirus (HPV).
Any similar growth occurring in plants or animals, such as the parotoid glands in the back of toads.
Any of the prefixes used in Hungarian notation.
Not to be entered or used; restricted.
definitions.example: The pond was off-limits to swimmers.

definitions.definition: The repetition of similar or identical vowel sounds (though with different consonants), usually in literature or poetry.
A woman who is fiercely protective of one or more people in her care.
A mother who drives her child/children very hard to succeed in school or in extracurricular studies like learning a musical instrument.
One who minds, tends, or watches something such as a child, a machine, or cattle; a keeper
A personal bodyguard.
A guide assigned by the authorities to foreign visitors so as to exercise control over their contacts with the populace.
One who is taken care of, such as a pauper child in the care of private person; a ward.
A drug or substance that counteracts the effects of a histamine. Commonly used to alleviate the symptoms of hay fever and other allergies.
A constructor of machines and engines; one versed in the principles of machines.
One skilled in the use of machine tools for fashioning metal parts or tools out of metal.
A person who operates machinery.
A person employed to shift scenery in a theater.
The male sex and endocrine gland, found in some types of animals, that produces sperm and male sex hormones, including the steroid testosterone.
The tenure of property held by a lessee under a lease.
A property held by such tenure.
Set deeply below a surface, as on a face.
definitions.example: His haggard eyes were deep-set, sunken into their sockets from exhaustion.

definitions.definition: To move upwards
To be built or erected
definitions.example: There are new offices going up in town.

definitions.definition: To rise or increase in price, cost, or value.
definitions.example: Bananas have gone up because of a shortage.

definitions.definition: To be consumed by fire.
definitions.example: The building went up in smoke.   Once the fire got out of the basement, the building went up in minutes.

definitions.definition: To forget lines or blocks during public performance.
definitions.example: The producer hopes nobody goes up opening night.

definitions.definition: To attend university.
An incrustation over a sore, wound, vesicle, or pustule, formed during healing.
The scabies.
The mange, especially when it appears on sheep.
Any of several different diseases of potatoes producing pits and other damage on their surface, caused by streptomyces bacteria (but formerly believed to be caused by a fungus).
Common scab, a relatively harmless variety of scab (potato disease) caused by Streptomyces scabies.
Any one of various more or less destructive fungal diseases that attack cultivated plants, forming dark-colored crustlike spots.
(founding) A slight irregular protuberance which defaces the surface of a casting, caused by the breaking away of a part of the mold.
A mean, dirty, paltry fellow.
A worker who acts against trade union policies, especially a strikebreaker.
To become covered by a scab or scabs.
To form into scabs and be shed, as damaged or diseased skin.
To remove part of a surface (from).
To act as a strikebreaker.
To beg (for), to cadge or bum.
definitions.example: I scabbed some money off a friend.

definitions.definition: (games) A two-player game played on a three-by-three grid, in which players take it in turns to place their respective symbol (either a nought or a cross) in a cell of the grid, the objective being to form a row, column or diagonal of three of one's own symbol.
A written or printed enumeration of the dishes served at a banquet, or of the dishes (with prices listed) that may be ordered at a restaurant, etc.
An emulsion of butter and lemon juice using egg yolks as the emulsifying agent, used in French cooking.
A local region of low atmospheric pressure, or a local downward current; especially one that causes an aircraft to lose height suddenly
Something that serves an ancillary function, such as an easel for a painter.
An auxiliary.
Subordinate; secondary; auxiliary
To make noisy puffing sounds, as of a steam locomotive.
To break wind.
To intermittently extinguish and reignite a powder charge.
Very pleased or satisfied; delighted.
Disgruntled, displeased, unsatisfied (This word can be its own antonym. [Is this slang, sarcasm, reverse psychology, etc?])
Any of various small, green, seedless plants growing on the ground or on the surfaces of trees, stones, etc.; now specifically, a plant of the phylum Bryophyta (formerly division Musci).
A kind or species of such plants.
Any alga, lichen, bryophyte, or other plant of seemingly simple structure.
definitions.example: Irish moss

definitions.definition: A bog; a fen.
definitions.example: the mosses of the Scottish border

definitions.definition: To become covered with moss.
definitions.example: An oak whose boughs were mossed with age.

definitions.definition: To cover (something) with moss.
(of fish) To form into, or travel in a school.
To educate, teach, or train (often, but not necessarily, in a school).
definitions.example: Many future prime ministers were schooled in Eton.

definitions.definition: To defeat emphatically, to teach an opponent a harsh lesson.
To control, or compose, one's expression.
definitions.example: She took care to school her expression, not giving away any of her feelings.

definitions.definition: Training or instruction.
Institutional education; attendance of school.
definitions.example: I never let my schooling interfere with my education.

definitions.definition: The training of a horse at dressage.
Discipline; reproof; reprimand.
definitions.example: He gave his son a good schooling.

definitions.definition: Compensation for instruction; price or reward paid to an instructor for teaching pupils.
A Basque ball game in which the players propel the ball using a long basket attached to the wrist
A person affected with hypochondria.
Related to, or affected by hypochondria
Related to, or located in the hypochondrium.
A piece of furniture for the storage and display of books.
A moderate degree of heat; the sensation of being warm.
Friendliness, kindness or affection.
Fervor, intensity of emotion or expression.
The effect of using mostly red and yellow hues.
A signalling device positioned at a road intersection or pedestrian crossing to indicate when it may be safe to drive, ride or walk, using a universal colour code.
The coloured dots on stamp sheet margins printed with offset litho or photogravure methods, used by the printers to check colour accuracy.
: One of the two officials at an association football match, previously known as linesmen, who assist the referee.
Habitual kindness or mildness of temper or disposition; amiability.
The number of neutrons or protons in nuclei which are required to fill the major quantum shells, and thus produce exceptionally stable nuclei: 2, 8, 20, 28, 50, 82 and 126.
A metric used to determine a team's required performance to make the playoffs.
A number which is manually entered into source code, rather than defined somewhere as a named constant; especially one which is arbitrary or lacks explanation.
definitions.example: We replaced the magic number 31 with a constant called MAX_DAYS_IN_MONTH.

definitions.definition: A number which cannot occur in normal use, typically used as a placeholder (e.g. a fictitious date such as 2000-02-32).
A hash code, such as those used by some webmail servers to keep track of sessions.
A number in a file’s content that identifies the filetype.
Hydroelectric power
Small, usually curved scissors used for cutting fingernails, and toenails.
Wavering; lacking in commitment, certainty, or support; namby-pamby.
definitions.example: Not wanting to be pressed for details, public relations gave a wishy-washy answer.

definitions.definition: Thin or watery.
definitions.example: The wishy-washy orange juice served by the cafeteria not only failed to be sweet; it was barely orange.

definitions.definition: The projection of a mammary gland from which, on female mammals, milk is secreted.
A mechanical device through which liquids or gases can be passed in a regulated manner.
An artificial nipple (definition 1) used for bottle-feeding infants.
Any small physical protrusion, such as the lumps on the F and J keys on computer keyboards.
Any small physical protrusion on an automotive, a machine part or any other part that fits into a groove on another part.
A perforated segment that fits into part of the breech of a muzzle-loading gun, on which the percussion cap is fixed.
A short tube threaded at both ends, used as a connector.
An internally threaded piece which holds a bicycle spoke in place on the rim.
definitions.example: Turn the nipples on to the bicycle spokes only one turn, for each spoke on the new wheel all the way around until they are all snug, then check alignment.

definitions.definition: To fit (a baby's bottle, etc.) with a nipple.
To give one's nipple to (a baby) to allow breastfeeding.
A form of psychotherapy where patients are treated as a group, using group dynamics.
To post on a microblog.
definitions.example: I started microblogging last week.

definitions.definition: The writing or publishing of a microblog.
definitions.example: A variety of microblogging sites have sprung up.

definitions.definition: A grimace.
To mumble, speak unclearly.
To move the lips with the mouth closed; to mumble, as in sulkiness.
To beg, especially if using a repeated phrase.
To deprive of (something) by cheating; to impose upon.
To cheat; to deceive; to play the beggar.
To be sullen or sulky.
To nibble.
A cube of peat.
A contagious disease caused by the Mumps virus of the genus Rubulavirus, mostly occurring in childhood, which causes swelling of glands in the face and neck.
A gloomy or sullen silence.
A fictitious name used by an author in place of their actual name; a writer's pseudonym.
Not moral; inconsistent with rectitude, purity, or good morals; contrary to conscience or the divine law.
A speech sound articulated with both lips.
Articulated with both lips.
